definition: to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: Shortly afterward, the Anyuanding executives were detained.
sentences.chinese: 不久之後，安元鼎主管被拘留。

sentences.english: Mr. Nami, now detained by police, couldn't be reached for comment.
sentences.chinese: 波和二現在被警方拘留，無法獲得他對本案的評論。

sentences.english: Criminal laws stipulate that detention de bene esse can apply to active criminal.
sentences.chinese: 刑事訴訟法規定對現行犯可以適用先行拘留。

sentences.english: The government's detention of Ai Weiwei appears to have been carefully planned.
sentences.chinese: 政府拘留艾未未的過程似乎經周密策劃。

sentences.english: A fifth leader Wei Xiaoyang was reportedly detained by Peng's faction.
sentences.chinese: 第五領導人魏曉陽據說被拘留了彭的派系。

sentences.english: While in Iraq, Brown processed insurgents and detainees , the NYCLU said.
sentences.chinese: 但在伊拉克，布朗工人反叛者和被拘留者，尼克魯說。

sentences.english: A young boy was arrested by the police for robbing passengers.
sentences.chinese: 一名少年因攔路搶劫路人被警方拘留。

sentences.english: Beijing has not said the detentions are tied to iron ore negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 北京方面並沒有說拘留跟鐵礦石談判有關。

sentences.english: I've put her away in the detention room.
sentences.chinese: 我已經把她關在拘留房裏面了啦。

sentences.english: Chapelle demands that Mason immediately end the situation at the facility.
sentences.chinese: 薛潘要求梅森立即終結拘留所的狀況。

sentences.english: It is a top secret, government detention center.
sentences.chinese: 這是一座高度機密的政府拘留中心。

sentences.english: Two years ago, Congress formally apologized for the internment.
sentences.chinese: 兩年前，國會爲拘留一事正式道歉。

sentences.english: But Asia is still in custody and can not be released.
sentences.chinese: 不過亞奧還在拘留中，並且不能保釋。

sentences.english: One day of restricted freedom of person shall be offset against one day of administrative detention.
sentences.chinese: 限制人身自由一日，折抵行政拘留一日。

sentences.english: The criminals were put under arrest and dealt with in accordance with law.
sentences.chinese: 這些犯罪分子均被逮捕，依法拘留。

sentences.english: The men were pulled in on suspicion of having committed a burglary.
sentences.chinese: 這些人因涉嫌犯有夜盜罪而被拘留。

definition: to detain as criminal/criminal detention/abbr. for 刑事拘留[xing2 shi4 ju1 liu2]
release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)
residential surveillance, a form of noncustodial house arrest
limited term of imprisonment (i.e. anything less than life imprisonment)
